instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
came in with water damage around u7000 repaired some traces and replaced u7000.
after that I took the board to Louis and it just turned on,,, around the right fan where its connected to the board the screw bracket is broken off.

today I had some time and picked up the board again,.

found a short on u5850 after replacing it short is gone.

now I also have pm_slp_s4_l back.

no fan spin and no vcore

CPUIMVP_TON both resistors measure good 181.9k and 182,1k
also when measuring from the pin 1 red and pin 48 black 364k

any idear where to go next.

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
no cpuvcore

PP3V3_S0  present


u7950

pin 1 0.021v
pin 2 0.064v
pin 3  0
pin 4 0
pin 5 0
pin 6 0
pin 7 0
pin 8 3.3

missing CPUIMVP_PGOOD
missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD

CPUIMVP_PGOOD comes from u7400
pin 46 5v
    29 5v
    19 5v

CPUIMVP_VR_ON enables the u7400 chip


CPUIMVP_VR_ON comes from  ALL_SYS_PWRGD

q7950
pin 1 0.002v  PP1V05_S0_VMON  
pin 2 un NC  
pin 3 0.020v ground  
pin 4 0.020v ALL_SYS_PWRGD 
pin 5 1.068v VMON_3V3_DIV 
pin 6 3.27v PP3V3_S5_VMON
pin 7 0 PP1V5_S3RS0_VMON
pin 8 2.7v NC

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: ALL_SYS_PWRGD, cames from the point where R7967 is tied to R7963-R7969, if one of the PGOOD signals is not coming high this will pull down ALL_SYS_PWRGD.... Measure big coils and check what voltage is missing.....

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
ty aprendiz, so its indeed the other way around, first u7960 line up then q7950
ill check them thanks

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: U7960 is not present, so only resistors....

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: Yup I mean that. With "line up" on schematic.

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
oke wanted to measure today, I pluged in the board and had 0 on the first few resitors.
I then stoped and went back to the power lines.
when I came to PP3V3_S0 I got 0 at probing one of the caps.

when I released the probe the fan started to spin.

I then unplugged to see if I could reproduce. tobad no.

but now I don't have any volts at
PP3V3_S3             0.020v
PP3V3_S0             0.094v

I got 3.34 volts at PP3V3_S5

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: You are measuring S0 voltages while S3 is not even there. Is SLP_S4 high?

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
yes I measured it again because it was present before. s5->s3>s0

PM_SLP_S4_L   3.31v

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
SMC_LID 3.4v

horrible,,  second time the logic board is just booting and gives fan spin while measuring around, even thou totally different place. then disconnecd charger and no boot again..........

threads.title: 820-3332  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: Corrosion somewhere. Impossible to remotely diagnose, inspect all areas that had corrosion. Maybe under SMC if there was corrosion there.
